item.title: Acquiring AI talent wholesale
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups.  This week we are looking at acquisitions of small startups, two new unicorns, wearable AI devices, and VCs who are supporting Kamala Harris. item.title: Character.AI CEO Noam Shazeer returns to Google
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
In a big move, Character.AI co-founder and CEO Noam Shazeer is returning to Google after leaving the company in October 2021 to found the a16z-backed startup. In his previous stint, Shazeer spearheaded the team of researchers that built LaMDA (Language Model for Dialogue Applications), a language model that was used for conversational AI tools. Character.AI co-founder Daniel De […]

item.title: Adept Materials’ dehumidifying paint was inspired by trees and semiconductors
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The startup developed a two-material system that helps homes self-regulate their internal humidity.

item.title: Yelp’s lack of transparency around API charges angers developers
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
When the developers replied to the July 19 email, Yelp sent a deck of pricing tiers with base pricing starting from $229 per month for a limit of 1,000 API calls per day.

item.title: Cloud infrastructure revenue approached $80 billion this quarter
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
The cloud infrastructure market has put the doldrums of 2023 firmly behind it with another big quarter. Revenue continues to grow at a brisk pace, fueled by interest in AI. Synergy Research reports revenue totaled $79 billion for the quarter, up $14.1 billion or 22% from last year. This marked the third consecutive quarter that […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Why did Wiz walk away from $23 billion?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
As widely reported, Wiz recently said no to a $23 billion acquisition offer from Google. At that price, it would have been Google’s biggest acquisition ever. It’s possible the Google team got cold feet during due diligence, or there may have been concerns that regulators would have challenged an acquisition of this size. But all […]

item.title: Pharma giant Cencora is alerting millions about its data breach
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
The pharma giant won't say how many patients were affected by its February data breach. A count by TechCrunch confirms that over a million people are affected.

item.title: Self-driving truck startup Aurora Innovation to sell up to $420M in shares ahead of commercial launch
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Self-driving technology company Aurora Innovation is looking to raise hundreds of millions in additional capital as it races toward a driverless commercial launch by the end of 2024.  Aurora is pursuing a driver-as-a-service model, wherein carriers purchase trucks with the Aurora Driver tech on board and then offer their services via those trucks to shippers. […]

item.title: Rediff, once an internet pioneer in India, sells majority stake for $3M
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Payments infrastructure firm Infibeam Avenues has acquired a majority 54% stake in Rediff.com for up to $3 million, a dramatic twist of fate for the 28-year-old business that was the first Indian internet firm to list on Nasdaq back in the year 2000. Founded in 1996, Rediff rode the initial dot-com wave to become one […]

item.title: Terraform Labs co-founder and crypto fugitive Do Kwon set for extradition to South Korea
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
The ruling confirmed an earlier decision in April from the High Court of Podgorica which rejected a request to extradite the crypto fugitive to the United States.

item.title: Meta’s Threads crosses 200 million active users
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
A day after Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg talked about his newest social media experiment Threads reaching “almost” 200 million users on the company’s Q2 2024 earnings call, the platform has touched the milestone. Instagram head Adam Mosseri confirmed that the Twitter rival has reached 200 million active users in a post on Threads. Meta has […]

item.description:
TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 will be in San Francisco on October 28–30, and we’re already excited! Disrupt brings innovation for every stage of your startup journey, and we could not bring you this world-class event without our world-class partners. item.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
The tech layoff wave is still going strong in 2024. Following significant workforce reductions in 2022 and 2023, this year has already seen 60,000 job cuts across 254 companies, according to independent layoffs tracker Layoffs.fyi. Companies like Tesla, Amazon, Google, TikTok, Snap and Microsoft have conducted sizable layoffs in the first months of 2024. Smaller-sized […]

item.title: Intel to lay off 15,000 employees
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Intel announced it would lay off more than 15% of its staff, or 15,000 employees, in a memo to employees on Thursday. The massive headcount is part of a large plan to reduce spending by $10 billion in 2025, following a dismal second-quarter earnings report and outlook. “Our revenues have not grown as expected — […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: AI music startup Suno claims training model on copyrighted music is ‘fair use’
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Following the recent lawsuit filed by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) against music generation startups Udio and Suno, Suno admitted in a court filing on Thursday that it did, in fact, train its AI model using copyrighted songs. But it claimed that doing so was legal under the fair-use doctrine. The RIAA filed the lawsuit […]

item.title: iPad sales help bail out Apple amid a continued iPhone slide
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
In spite of a drop for the quarter, iPhone remained Apple’s most important category by a wide margin.

item.title: How filming a cappella concerts and dance recitals led Northzone’s newest partner Molly Alter to a career in VC
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Molly Alter wears a lot of hats. She’s a mocumentary filmmaker working on a project about an alternate reality where charades is big business. She’s a caesar salad connoisseur and documents her rankings of different restaurants’ attempts on a blog called JULIUS. She’s also Northzone’s newest partner. Alter’s path to venture capital was not an […]

item.title: Microsoft now lists OpenAI as a competitor in AI and search
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Microsoft has a long and tangled history with OpenAI, having invested a reported $13 billion in the ChatGPT maker as part of a long-term partnership. As part of the deal, Microsoft runs OpenAI’s models across its enterprise and consumer products and is OpenAI’s exclusive cloud provider. However, the tech giant called the startup a “competitor” […]

item.title: Sequoia-backed Knowde raises Series C at a valuation cut
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
The San Jose-based startup raised $60 million in a round that values it lower than the $500 million valuation it garnered in its most recent round, according to multiple sources.

item.title: Twitter disappears from Mac App Store
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
X (formerly Twitter) can no longer be accessed in the Mac App Store, suggesting that it has been officially delisted.  Searches for both “Twitter” and “X” on Apple’s platform no longer surface the app. The URL no longer works, either. Instead, it displays a pop-up message indicating that it is unavailable. This means new users […]
